segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Create a pagefile security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Create a pagefile security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Create a pagefile security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Create a pagefile security policy setting.

segment.source: Windows designates a section of the hard drive as virtual memory known as the page file, or more specifically, as pagefile.sys.
segment.target: Windows designates a section of the hard drive as virtual memory known as the page file, or more specifically, as pagefile.sys.

segment.source: It is used to supplement the computer’s Random Access Memory (RAM) to improve performance for programs and data that are used frequently.
segment.target: It is used to supplement the computer’s Random Access Memory (RAM) to improve performance for programs and data that are used frequently.

segment.source: Although the file is hidden from browsing, you can manage it using the system settings.
segment.target: Although the file is hidden from browsing, you can manage it using the system settings.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which users can create and change the size of a page file.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which users can create and change the size of a page file.

segment.source: It determines whether users can specify a page file size for a particular drive in the Performance Options box located on the Advanced tab of the System Properties dialog box or through using internal application interfaces (APIs).
segment.target: It determines whether users can specify a page file size for a particular drive in the Performance Options box located on the Advanced tab of the System Properties dialog box or through using internal application interfaces (APIs).

segment.source: Restrict the Create a pagefile user right to Administrators, which is the default.
segment.target: Restrict the Create a pagefile user right to Administrators, which is the default.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default, members of the Administrators group have this right.
segment.target: By default, members of the Administrators group have this right.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users who can change the page file size could make it extremely small or move the file to a highly fragmented storage volume, which could cause reduced device performance.
segment.target: Users who can change the page file size could make it extremely small or move the file to a highly fragmented storage volume, which could cause reduced device performance.

segment.source: Restrict the Create a pagefile user right to members of the Administrators group.
segment.target: Restrict the Create a pagefile user right to members of the Administrators group.

segment.source: Restricting this right to members of the Administrators group is the default configuration.
segment.target: Restricting this right to members of the Administrators group is the default configuration.
